doc.previous: The bird was also kept by MÄori as a pet, and like the tui, it could be trained to say a few words.[8] There is also a record of a tame huia kept by European settlers in a small village in the Forty-Mile Bush in the 19th century.[11]
doc.after: New Zealand has released several postage stamps portraying the huia,[39][40] and the New Zealand sixpence circulated from 1933 to 1966 featured a female huia on the reverse.
